intro: Primula cerina, commonly known as the white primrose, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and broad, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in woodlands and meadows. The flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
